page.title: 04LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: Land,buildings Blackhead. A clifftop plateau of 61 feet average. Stone hedges devide the fields which average 3 acres.Although two farmers are taking out hedges to make average 10 acre fields. The North west corner of the block is higher and has large boulders scattered about with very little soil and sparse scraggy vegetation.It has probably never been cultivated. The centre and south has better soil and grows good grass and barley. The buildings are of stone and cob with slate roofs. Many small concrete buildings were left by the RAF after the second world war Modern plastic based paint is being increasingly used for protection..
